metadata.title: CVE-2023-41105 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in Python 3.11 through 3.11.4. If a path containing'\0' bytes is passed to os.path.normpath(), the path will be truncatedunexpectedly at the first '\0' byte. There are plausible cases in which anapplication would have rejected a filename for security reasons in Python3.10.x or earlier, but that filename is no longer rejected in Python3.11.x.

criterions.comment: python2.7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
python3.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
python3.7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
